Action.author: danielhardman
Action.body: This feels to me like a desirable enhancement. I'd like to fit it in quickly.

Action.author: lovesh
Action.body: So the problem that you are trying to solve is making the client library agnostic to how relevant key(s) of a transaction are encoded to be stored in the state trie. I don't consider this as a problem until we decide to change in future how we encode keys from a transaction.

Action.author: ashcherbakov
Action.body: Yes. I agree that it's not a critical problem, but this is a nice enhancement that can allow us to have cleaner code and better maintainability (less dependency between libindy and indy-node implementation details).

Action.author: ashcherbakov
Action.body: I believe we will not do this in a near future
